verses.verse: Boast <WH1984> not thyself of to morrow <WH4279>; for thou knowest <WH3045> not what a day <WH3117> may bring forth <WH3205>. to: Heb. to morrow day
Let another man <WH2114> praise <WH1984> thee, and not thine own mouth <WH6310>; a stranger <WH5237>, and not thine own lips <WH8193>.
A stone <WH68> is heavy <WH3514>, and the sand <WH2344> weighty <WH5192>; but a fool's <WH191> wrath <WH3708> is heavier <WH3515> than them both <WH8147>. heavy: Heb. heaviness

Wrath <WH2534> is cruel <WH395>, and anger <WH639> is outrageous <WH7858>; but who is able to stand <WH5975> before <WH6440> envy <WH7068>? Wrath: Heb. Wrath is cruelty, and anger an overflowing envy: or, jealousy?
Open <WH1540> rebuke <WH8433> is better <WH2896> than secret <WH5641> love <WH160>.
Faithful <WH539> are the wounds <WH6482> of a friend <WH157>; but the kisses <WH5390> of an enemy <WH8130> are deceitful <WH6280>. deceitful: or, earnest, or, frequent
The full <WH7649> soul <WH5315> loatheth <WH947> an honeycomb <WH5317>; but to the hungry <WH7457> soul <WH5315> every bitter thing <WH4751> is sweet <WH4966>. loatheth: Heb. treadeth under foot
As a bird <WH6833> that wandereth <WH5074> from her nest <WH7064>, so is a man <WH376> that wandereth <WH5074> from his place <WH4725>.

Ointment <WH8081> and perfume <WH7004> rejoice <WH8055> the heart <WH3820>: so doth the sweetness <WH4986> of a man's friend <WH7453> by hearty <WH5315> counsel <WH6098>. by: Heb. from the counsel of the soul

Thine own friend <WH7453>, and thy father's <WH1> friend <WH7453>, forsake <WH5800> not; neither go <WH935> into thy brother's <WH251> house <WH1004> in the day <WH3117> of thy calamity <WH343>: for better <WH2896> is a neighbour <WH7934> that is near <WH7138> than a brother <WH251> far off <WH7350>.
My son <WH1121>, be wise <WH2449>, and make my heart <WH3820> glad <WH8055>, that I may answer <WH7725> <WH1697> him that reproacheth <WH2778> me.
A prudent <WH6175> man foreseeth <WH7200> the evil <WH7451>, and hideth <WH5641> himself; but the simple <WH6612> pass on <WH5674>, and are punished <WH6064>.
Take <WH3947> his garment <WH899> that is surety <WH6148> for a stranger <WH2114>, and take a pledge <WH2254> of him for a strange woman <WH5237>.
He that blesseth <WH1288> his friend <WH7453> with a loud <WH1419> voice <WH6963>, rising early <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242>, it shall be counted <WH2803> a curse <WH7045> to him.
A continual <WH2956> dropping <WH1812> in a very rainy <WH5464> day <WH3117> and a contentious <WH4079> <WH4066> woman <WH802> are alike <WH7737>.
Whosoever hideth <WH6845> her hideth <WH6845> the wind <WH7307>, and the ointment <WH8081> of his right hand <WH3225>, which bewrayeth <WH7121> itself.
Iron <WH1270> sharpeneth <WH2300> iron <WH1270>; so a man <WH376> sharpeneth <WH2300> the countenance <WH6440> of his friend <WH7453>.
Whoso keepeth <WH5341> the fig tree <WH8384> shall eat <WH398> the fruit <WH6529> thereof: so he that waiteth <WH8104> on his master <WH113> shall be honoured <WH3513>.
As in water <WH4325> face <WH6440> answereth to face <WH6440>, so the heart <WH3820> of man <WH120> to man <WH120>.
Hell <WH7585> and destruction <WH11> <WH10> are never <WH3808> full <WH7646>; so the eyes <WH5869> of man <WH120> are never satisfied <WH7646>. never: Heb. not
As the fining pot <WH4715> for silver <WH3701>, and the furnace <WH3564> for gold <WH2091>; so is a man <WH376> to <WH6310> his praise <WH4110>.
Though thou shouldest bray <WH3806> a fool <WH191> in a mortar <WH4388> among <WH8432> wheat <WH7383> with a pestle <WH5940>, yet will not his foolishness <WH200> depart <WH5493> from him.
Be thou diligent <WH3045> to know <WH3045> the state <WH6440> of thy flocks <WH6629>, and look <WH7896> well <WH3820> to thy herds <WH5739>. look: Heb. set thy heart
For riches <WH2633> are not for ever <WH5769>: and doth the crown <WH5145> endure to every <WH1755> generation <WH1755>? riches: Heb. strength to: Heb. to generation and generation?
The hay <WH2682> appeareth <WH1540>, and the tender grass <WH1877> sheweth <WH7200> itself, and herbs <WH6212> of the mountains <WH2022> are gathered <WH622>.
The lambs <WH3532> are for thy clothing <WH3830>, and the goats <WH6260> are the price <WH4242> of the field <WH7704>.

And thou shalt have goats' <WH5795> milk <WH2461> enough <WH1767> for thy food <WH3899>, for the food <WH3899> of thy household <WH1004>, and for the maintenance <WH2416> for thy maidens <WH5291>. maintenance: Heb. life
